direction.raw_text: We see an Italian village at the height of the plague.  Funeral processions, decrepit houses with their windows boarded up... the stench of death all around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :  EUROPE. THE DARK AGES Through the filth a KNIGHT walks his horse.  He is weary but not so dingy as his surrounding; a stranger in these parts. He comes to an inn, where a boy takes his horse round back. He enters the inn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The inn is dark and almost empty.  A couple of patrons drink silently at tables.  Behind the bar stands a slovenly BARMAID, dark-haired and lazy.  She scratches at her shoulder, on which we see a birthmark.  The knight approaches the bar, throws money down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The barmaid pours him a cup of ale.  He drinks deep, stands a moment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: A tankard of ale, wench.

direction.raw_text: The barmaid leads the knight, by candlelight, upstairs to his room.  The door opens inward.  The knight stands in the doorway, places a hand on the barmaid's hip.  She pauses a moment, then breaks free of his grasp, starts down the hall.  He laughs a bit, resignedly, and closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands behind it.  Not two feet from the knight, grinning at him.  His eyes are skull-hollow and dancing in his head, his bloody smile full with teeth.  His skin is gray, and peeling.  The knight turns slowly and sees him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vampire licks his lips. He is on the knight in a second, pushing him backwards into the middle of the small room.  The knight struggles but is no match for the vampire, who buries his face in the knight's neck.  The knight screams.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, my god...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It suddenly flies open, the lock shattered. The vampire turns like a frightened animal.  In the doorway stands the barmaid, a SLAYER.  In her hand is a wooden stake. The vampire drops the knight, who crabs backwards into a corner. The Slayer and the vampire come at each other.  The Slayer spins and kicks; the vampire flies back.  Snarling, he comes back at the slayer.  They struggle; he slips free and is out the door. For a moment, the Slayer remains still, crouched on the floor. The knight watches her.  She seems to be making a decision -- perhaps even knows what is going to happen. She runs at the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The vampire comes running out the front door.  Before he is a few feet from the front of the inn, the Slayer SMASHES through the upstairs window and lands on him.  They both hit the ground, and she plants the stake right in his heart. After a moment, we hear a voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are ten or more vampires walking slowly toward her in the otherwise deserted street.  At the front, maybe ten feet away, is AMILYN. Amilyn is a grinning jackal, a servant to the Vampire-King. His garb is a rotted approximation of a courtier's livery.  He ambles toward the Slayer, giggling, as she stands. Behind her is LOTHOS, the Vampire-King.  His skin is deep white, and smooth.  He wears a long coat -- his dress is not of any era.  He is practically upon her before he speaks.

direction.raw_text: She turns.  He smiles, almost lovingly.

direction.raw_text: He pulls her head back swiftly, snapping her spine as her head hits the back of her legs.  Lightning flashes.

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Buffy at the mall with Kimberly, Nicole and Jennifer.  For the first time, we really see how she stands out against her friends.  She is wearing much more functional, cool garb, and less makeup, while they still sport the same dainty shit from the beginning. They stop to look at some dresses.  Something in the next store catches Buffy's eye; she wanders off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gary Murray is crouching on his desk.  Buffy still sits.  The FLY still BUZZES. As Gary talks, Buffy picks up a push pin from the table beside her, holds it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy surreptitiously puts the push pin in her mouth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ... and I could see the music flowing into me, it was bright red and electric, and I felt like a big toaster, and I thought, maybe I am a toaster, we're all molecules, and my friend Melissa, her head looked like a big party balloon, and that scared me, I started to freak out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The other girls are moving on from the dress shop, notice Buffy is not with them.  They spot her in the next shop, urge her to come on.  Buffy puts back the chain saw she was looking at, follows them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy hasn't moved, or opened her mouth.  The FLY BUZZES on. Gary Murray now sits behind his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy smiles at Gary.  As he looks away for a second, Buffy spits out the push pin.  The BUZZING STOPS.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I guess you're surprised.  Well, you know, there's more to most people than meets the eye.  Everybody's got a secret.  I just want you to know that you can always share your secrets with me.  What you say in this office, it will stay in this office.  I'm your pal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Buffy sparring with Merrick again.  She holds a stake.  This time she ends up pinning him, the stake at his solar plexus. He moves the point to where his heart would be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is a shambles.  Outside the first floor window, it is dark night.  "Help Yourself" by the Posies blasts from Pike's STEREO.  Pike lies on his bed. Through the window we see Benny approach, slowly fading up to the pane.  He's floating, really.  (He's a vampire.)  He scrapes his fingers on the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike sits up, turns down the music.  He goes to the window, begins to try to open it.  It's stuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike gets a good look at Benny for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Benny grins, presses his slimy forehead against the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He laughs at his impression, brown spittle caking the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Benny smiles, moves suddenly out of sight.  Pike looks at the window for a second, then bolts out of his room.  He runs to the front door, frantically hooks the chain.  Benny appears at the door's little window, banging and scraping the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike backs away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Pike...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Benny, man, where you been?  You bailed on me, I passed out, man, I almost did a Jimi Hendrix!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, I'm trying, but this window is burnt --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Invite me in, Pike.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute.  What's wrong with you, man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look like shit, Benny.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... feel.... pretty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No offense, man, but I think you're on something nasty.  Why don't you just go and cool out and I'll see you in the morning or something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The sun!  It burns!  It burns!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Let me in, Pike!  I'm hungry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get away from here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm hungry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm hungry!  I'm hungry!  I'm hungry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Buffy walks slowly down the street, trying to appear nonchalant, but looking about her a lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She whistles some, keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She passes an alley and there is a RUSTLING amid the garbage cans.  She moves slowly down the alley toward the noise.  She is about halfway down when a rat scurries out from the cans and down a drain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behind her, another SOUND.  She turns slowly.  At the entrance to the alley stands a vampire.  They stare at each other, some thirty feet away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves back a step.  The vampire takes a step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It floats rapidly at her, hissing.  Buffy looks about her frantically, trapped.  It hits her at top speed and she instantly rolls onto her back, flipping it and hurling it against the wall at the end of the alley.  As it hits, Buffy, still rolling, produces a stake from her jacket and throws it directly at its heart.  The stake punctures the startled creature's chest.  Before he can so much as grab it, Buffy throws a roundhouse kick, driving the stake all the way home with her foot.  The vampire screams, sinks to the ground. Buffy turns, triumphant.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sure is cold.  What a dark night. Nice night for a walk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) 'Feelings, la la la la feelings'... Boy, I'm helpless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Yeucch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Hello...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) What do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Toaster-caked him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A hand stops it.  It is Merrick, who steps into the alley and stares at Buffy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two exit Merrick's car, an old Dodge Dart.  As they talk, they make their way into the warehouse.  Buffy looks out for trouble while Merrick unlocks the door.  This is obviously their routine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They enter the warehouse.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He was slow.  Very simple.  They won't all be that easy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the alley was a mistake.  Never corner yourself like that.  If they'd come at you in force you'd be dead now.  One vampire is a lot easier to kill then ten.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does the world 'Duhh' mean anything to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You felt a little sick, didn't you? The cramps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They unload their stuff as they argue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merrick turns on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy looks at him a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In spite of himself, Merrick smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nice conversationalist!  Yeah, I felt 'em a little, but I ain't due for two weeks since you're so excited about the subject.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's natural.  A reaction to their presence, to the... unnaturalness of it.  It's part of how you are able to track them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, wonderful.  My secret weapon is -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .  That's just great.  Thanks for telling me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'll get used to it.  I'm more worried about your tactical mistakes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are such a wet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A wet!  Didn't I just kill that vampire?  I think I did.  I didn't see you killing any vampires.  You were too busy playing 'Beat the Clock'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't start with me again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aren't I, like the chosen one?  The one and only?  The Grand High Poobah and doesn't that mean you have to be nice to me?  Like, ever?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Buffy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And why are you always wearing black? It's so down.  It's totally not your color.  I don't think you have a color.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want?  Encouragement? (in bad American accent) 'Gosh, Buffy, you're so special, I just want to give you a great big hug, oh I'm just having a warm fuzzy.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, fuck you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know how many girls I've trained to be Slayers?  Five.  Five properly prepared girls, girls who faced their responsibilities, who worked hard to become women overnight -- harder than you've ever worked in your life -- and I saw them ripped apart.  Do you want to live?  Do you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you think, that being able to jump about and hit people makes you a Slayer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Five?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So, basically, I've got the life expectancy of a zit, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not if you're careful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How can you keep doing this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's what I was raised to do.  There aren't many of us left, the Watchers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Watchers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's a small village in Hampshire, near Stonehenge... (sees she doesn't know it) ... near a bunch of big rocks. That's where I was born.  My father taught me about the training, about finding the Slayers, reading the signs.  There's a small cluster of us, a few families, really... most of the neighboring villagers think we're just a bunch of harmless old loonies.  I thought so myself for a time, when I was younger... (stops himself) I'm sorry.  I'm not supposed to... I shouldn't go on like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish you would.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It isn't important.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm curious, is all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Buffy, don't... don't start thinking of me as your friend.  It interferes with the work, and it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And it makes it worse when I die, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Well, you know, I'm not gonna kick so easy.  I've got a few things the other girls didn't have.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As for example, what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... there's my keen fashion sense, for one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vampires of the world, beware.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (impressed) Merrick.  You made a joke.  Are you okay, I mean, do you want to lie down?  I know it hurts the first time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Buffy, Nicole, Kimberly, and Jennifer are walking down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming from the opposite direction are Jeffrey, Andy and some of the other football players.  They're suited up and heading for the gym.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They pass Buffy.  Andy stops and grabs her from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unthinkingly, Buffy flips Andy over and pins him against a locker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jeffrey puts his arm around Buffy but she shakes it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy goes off by herself.  Jeffrey watches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lads move off.  We see Nicole, Kimberly and Jennifer, who have been watching the whole exchange.  Nicole and Kimberly are obviously disdainful of Buffy's behavior.  Jennifer is feeling sorry for Jeffrey.  Boy does she want him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So they found Cassandra's body out by the railway tunnels.  Nobody's saying anything, but they think she was involved in something, like, illegal or something.  Like dealing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I hope so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Probably was.  What do you suppose she was doing out there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eeyuu.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... And they're having some memorial service or something tomorrow.  You going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.  Coach said I had to work on my 'ab's.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Coach knows what abs are?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Got to get some!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Whoa!  Whoa!  I'm sorry.  I'm sorry. I don't actually need any right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Buffy) What's with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't grab me, okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Absolutely.  I see now the error of my mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, keep your mitts off my thang. I'll pop you one. (to Buffy) Did he scare you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can take care of myself, Jeffrey.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So I noticed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Nice to feel needed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's move out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rallying) Yes!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A mod, brightly lit store.  A little hipper than your usual mall fare, but not Melrose either.  Bright colors reign.  Buffy is standing by a dressing stall, inspecting her fingernails, talking to Merrick as he changes inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merrick comes out of the booth.  He wears multi-colored parachute pants and an equally loud T-shirt.  Buffy looks at him -- he looks at himself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I mean, most of the time Jeffrey's really sweet, but sometimes he gets kind of... 'Me-Tarzan'ish, you know what I mean?  Lately it bugs me, I guess. (no response) Merrick?  Are you still breathing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (from inside) I can't work this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We call them zippers.  They're not supposed to be a challenge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But it's in the back.  Why are we wasting time with this, anyway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because you clash, Merrick.  You clash with everything.  I mean you might as well go around with a sign, 'Slayers trained her.'  Honestly, you look like something out of... Pasadena.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My clothes have always been perfectly serviceable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you're on my turf now.  You're just gonna have to trust me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (doesn't like it either) Okay.  The important thing is not to panic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pike is hurriedly working on a part in the hood of his beat-up Dodge, which is filled with all his belongings.  ZEPH stands watching him.  Zeph is about forty-five, greasy, good-natured. Pike works for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike finishes, slams the hood.  He picks up a battered guitar case and stuffs it into the car, shuts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike gets in the car.  It sputter, starts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike peels out.  Zeph watches him go.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You said you'd have the part by two!  Christ, it's almost dark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What nasty bug crawled up your bungus and where the hell are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm leaving, man.  I'm bailing town. This place has gotten way too hairy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where am I gonna find another mechanic stupid enough to work for my money?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, have you seen Benny lately?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No...  You want me to give him a message?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should think about leaving, too, man.  Sell this place... Something's going on here.  I don't know.  Something real weird.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, you'll be coming back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right.  Take care of yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey.  What should I do if I see Benny?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Run.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's my guitar...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: burning down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the edge of town.  The car has stalled at an intersection. Pike is hunched over the wheel, his head down as he listens to the rasping ENGINE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amilyn appears in the street in front of the car.  Pike finally hears the SCRAPING OF HIS FEET as he approaches the car.  Pike straightens up slowly, and as the rear view mirror comes INTO THE FRAME, we see there are two more behind him.  They are both high-school age, fresh like Bessel and Benny.  They all approach, slowly. Pike waits for a second, his hand on the key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns the key again and the car ROARS to life.  The headlights trap the hungry scowl of the vampires as Pike pops the car in reverse, smashing into the back two vampires.  They both go flying, hurt but not killed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come on, come on.  Don't leave me, baby.  Come on, breathe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) This is for the money, baby.  Make me proud.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pike races at Amilyn, but he leaps up as Pike reaches him, and Pike hears a THUD as Amilyn lands on the roof of his car. Pike continues to bullet down the street as a hand suddenly punches through the roof, grabbing at him.  He fights off the hand and tries to control the speeding car. It can't be done:  he goes off the road and into a park.  The car careens along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amilyn ride it, laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike spots a tree with a low branch and heads for it.  Still fighting, he aims at the branch.  It gets closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amilyn looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They pass under the branch and we hear a TEARING THUD.  The arm stiffens and falls into Pike's lap. The car hits another tree dead on.  Pike slams into the steering wheel.  The guitar case flies right through the windshield and lands on the grass. Pike pulls himself slowly from the car.  He is bleeding, but not badly.  Just shaken.  He hears a low, seething WAIL from a few yards back and turns around.  Amilyn is getting shakily to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amilyn hisses at him, then turns and races away, snarling, clutching what's left of his arm. One of the other vampires nears him.  Pike tries to run and his knees buckle.  He lands on them right next to the guitar case.  As the vampire nears, he pulls the guitar out of the case and swings it, hitting the vampire in the head.  He hits him again.  The vampire bats away the guitar and grabs Pike. Brings his face to Pike's as Pike squirms. A blasting kick in the head from Buffy.  The vampire is flung to one side, falls.  He starts up at Buffy and she nails him with a stake.  Pike stares at her.  She pulls a walkie-talkie from her pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She puts the walkie-talkie back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The last vampire hits Pike from behind.  Without missing a beat, Buffy picks up the guitar and snaps the neck off.  She and the vampire meet in the middle -- the creature barely moves before she buries the guitar neck in its chest.  It falls. Merrick runs up.  He is wearing black jeans and a windbreaker. He is more modern than he was before, but subtly.  He sees the decaying bodies, one with a guitar sticking out of its chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike's eyes glaze over slightly as he collapses into Buffy's arms.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, give me a break.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (into walkie-talkie) I'm on the east side, near the playground...  all right.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that your car?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was.  I think it's pretty much ready for the --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Interesting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I kind of had to improvise. (to Pike) Sorry about your guitar.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's okay.  Umm, listen, I'm not.... I have to fall down now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Thrashing about the room in hysterics, screaming and snarling, banging his one fist on the boiler tank.  It booms hollowly. Lothos grabs him, throws him up against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lothos lets Amilyn go.  Amilyn still fumes, quietly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only Lothos smiles at the joke.  Amilyn raises his stump, looks at it.  The tattered end of his jacket covers the grossness of it, but it still isn't good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns toward his chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On his way through the door he passes a box on an oil drum. He plucks a large kitten out of it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong with you!?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My arm!  He took my fucking arm!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up!  You let him have it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) You reckless imbecile.  This place is ours for the taking and you let yourself... twelve hundred years old and you act like a child.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had him in my grasp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cheer up.  You may still.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (forlornly) I look horrible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The other two -- the new ones. Where are they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.  But the boy, he couldn't kill them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (thoughtfully) No... Not a boy... (gathers himself) Find out if they're dead.  And do something about that arm.  Honestly, I don't know how you made it through the Crusades.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Let me know about our little recruits.  I'll be in my chamber...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) ... having a snack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Buffy and Pike walk in, Pike still a bit unsteady on his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They move into the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy hands Pike the water and they move back into the living room.  Pike curls up in an armchair by the window.  Buffy begins stripping off her bloody clothes, leaving on a tank-top and jeans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Buffy strips down to her tank top, she notices a gash on her arm.  It's not bleeding much any more, but it's fairly impressive.  Pike jumps up to help as she pats it down with her shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike looks at her a moment as she wraps her shirt around it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy doesn't look up.  The questions seems to upset her a great deal.  She even fights back tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy smiles at this, though still upset.  She sits down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she stands anyway, head to the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She starts up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gives him a look, heads upstairs.  He watches her go, looks out the window.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How are you doing?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I'm good.  I'm good.  Kind of miss my knees, though.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want some water or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Water.  Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Do you do this kind of thing a lot? I mean, is this like a hobby?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not exactly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They were vampires, weren't they?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God!  Unbelievable.  Vampires.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You had a car full of stuff.  Were you leaving?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I was bailing.  I have a friend, and he's really... well, he's really vampire, I guess.  Bad scene.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, stay here tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks.  Tomorrow morning, I'm on a bus.  I'm gone.

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you gonna go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Of course I'm angry!  I leave you alone for five minutes, and look who you're hanging out with!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I don't want girls with good taste; I want a girl that tastes good!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I was gonna change you, man.  I was gonna give you life!  Do you know what that means?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gary Murray, yelling orders at student, holding a board against a window as vampires pound on it.  The exposed part of the window above him shatters, raining glass on his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A vampire is clutching a helpless girl as another vampire takes their picture with an Instamatic.  He expresses confusion and dismay when his image does not come out in the photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike is backing away from Benny, who is approaching him.  Pike passes an overturned table, the stubs of its broken legs sticking up at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Benny grabs him with hateful force.  His fingers dig into Pike's arms enough to draw blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike suddenly grabs Benny, holds him tightly in a brotherly embrace.  Benny is thrown slightly by this. Still holding him, Pike pitches onto the table, driving the leg-shard through Benny's back.  Pike still holds Benny as he twitches and screams, dying.  Finally, he lets go, gets up. He looks a little dazed, a little lost.  A window shattering far behind him pulls his eyes back into focus, and he goes to help.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Never die.  Never get kicked around, never get busted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) It means never having to say you're sorry!  And you blow it all off for that slut?!  What about my needs?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sitting by a wall, tiny and silent amid the carnage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy moves quickly along, crouching near a window and peering out.  Nothing.  She looks about her, waiting for an attack. She checks her purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cosmetics and hair spray.  A small cross.  No stakes left. Muttering under her breath, she moves swiftly into a classroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still moving cautiously, she heads for the window and pulls down the shade.  She crouches behind the teacher's desk and pulls the chair down to her, laying it on its side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She slams her elbow down on the chair leg -- very controlled, efficient motion -- and snaps it off.  Looks around to see if anyone is around to hear as she picks up the leg, now a weapon. She goes softly to the door, peers cautiously out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (cattily, to herself) 'Ooh, make me a woman, Jeffrey... oh, Jeffrey, you're so atheletical... I love you...'
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Looking out.  Amilyn's face appears right next to her, also looking out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy screams, turns, and Amilyn decks her, sends her flying back into the classroom.  The stake flies out of her hand.  It lands on a desk by the window. Buffy does not land nearly as well, crashing into a pile of desks and twisting her leg badly.  Amilyn laughs repulsively, advancing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kicks her again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs her by the neck with his one arm and pins her against the wall in the corner.  She reaches for the stake but it is just out of reach.  He is squeezing the life out of her, his face inches from hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy looks about for succor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All clear?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pleased to meet you!  Won't you guess my -- (kicks her hard)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (defiantly, through the pain) It wouldn't be 'Dick,' would it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) 'Lefty'?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a fool, bloodbag.  Die a fool and go to hell!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) The chosen one.  You're just another bloodbag -- not even fit to die for the Master.  When will you ever learn?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Buffy eyes the bottom of the shade, the pull dangling aimlessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pulls down hard on the shade pull and lets go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns in horror, letting go of Buffy, trying to catch the shade.  The instant he releases her, Buffy grabs the stake and in one swift motion, buries it in Amilyn's back. The shade goes up, flapping loudly as it spins.  It is still pitch black out.  Amilyn stare, wide-eyed and silent, at the night as he dies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amilyn spins, dying rage in his eyes.  He grabs her.  His strength is formidable even as his body begins to smoke. Suddenly screaming, he forces her over suddenly with such power that the two of them go crashing through the floorboards.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (with difficulty) I do know... one thing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know... what time sunrise is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's in about four hours, Dick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The two of them fall through the ceiling directly into the blood pool. Amilyn's body surfaces first, now just a husk. Buffy pops up from the waist-deep blood, soaked and wounded. She stays a moment, breathing hard.  Suddenly her eyes go wide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lothos rises from the pool, smiling.  Buffy is clearly paralyzed by fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves toward her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy is suddenly galvanized into action.  She throws a few punches at Lothos, but he takes them without flinching.  She grabs at the stake in what remains of Amilyn's chest.  Lightning quick, Lothos closes his hand around her and squeezes till the stake splinters and she screams with pain.  He knocks her back on her ass. She starts moving backward, away from him, but it is hard enough for her to make her way through the thick gore.  Lothos contemplates Amilyn's corpse, and his face darkens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she is up, turning to run.  He is thrown momentarily by her insolence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, god, no... not yet...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I knew you'd come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) You knew it, too, didn't you?  All your life, dreaming... waiting to feed me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) Ah, my fool is dead.  He was careless, always.  Still, I'll pull out your tongue for that. (coming toward her) Don't you understand?  I've killed you a dozen times.  Your life is not a blink of my eye, not a single breath.  I have lived in the shadows, in the pulsing filth behind men's eyes.  A thousand years, and more. I have conversed with the worms that fed on my corpse and I have bathed in the blood of emperors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (breaking the spell) Have you ever thrown up in the front row of a Richard Marx concert?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: But he is on her the moment she emerges from the chamber, grabbing her by the hair and throwing her to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kneels over her prostrate body.  She is reaching frantically into her purse.  He runs his hand along her body, a gesture both lustful and disdainful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pulls out a small cross, holds it in front of him.  He snarls at it, then grabs it, his hand around her.  The cross bursts into flame.  He holds her hand onto it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With her other hand, Buffy holds up her hair spray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She squeezes it at him, the spray catching fire form the cross and whooshes a jet of flame right into his face.  He screams, letting her go and backing up.  Hey, his head is on fire! Buffy turns and hobbles away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You waste time.  That is a sin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) You're even weaker than the others.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think you've forgotten something.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This?  This is you only weapon? Your puny faith?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) ... my keen fashion sense.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lothos stumbles about, head all aflame, till he finally pitches into the pool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy comes out of the boiler room and hobbles along, moving as fast as she can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches a locked door that says "Gymnasium -- Authorized Personnel Only".  Puts her shoulder to it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is the suckiest party I have ever been to.  It's not even a contest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As he pulls himself out of the pool, we are treated to a good look at his new head.  It is charred and torn almost beyond recognition.  It is so inhuman looking, that we are almost surprised when it screams!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SCREAM fills the hall.  Buffy is still working on the heavy metal door.  She turns, wide-eyed, at the SOUND.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Oops.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We TRACK rapidly through the cave, through the boiler room, the hall.  We're moving much too fast to be running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy pulls herself up through a trap door in the corner. Everything stops.  For a moment there is silence. Buffy gets shakily up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike and the others see her.  Pike and Andy run to her to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gary Murray stops in front of Kimberly, takes her face in his hand and lightly pops the back of her head against the wall. Cross-eyed, she slides back down into comatic silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pushes them away.  Lothos crashes through the trap door behind her, ugly and crazed.  He picks her up, floating a good two feet off the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hurls her the length of the room.  She hits a locker, which opens, spilling out someone's notebook.  The binder falls open, inside it is a plastic pen case with pens and pencils within. Buffy looks, by this time, like shit.  She props herself up as best she can, looks about her.  There is nothing wooden, nothing sharp, within reach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy charges Lothos from behind.  Pike tries to stop him, but is too late, as Lothos grabs him by the face without even looking at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Squeeze Andy's head until we hear something crack.  Lets him drop.  Looks around at the cowed students.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lothos roars.  Furious, he charges Buffy, his feet just skimming the ground, racing toward her, violently fast, upon her... She spins, on her feet in a flash, one quick motion.  She thrusts her palm forward and stops him, cold, like Superman stopping a train, palm at his chest. Silence.  Buffy looks directly into his eyes, the mad rictus of his face. Lothos stops, almost wide-eyed, as he looks down at his chest. Sticking out of the middle of his chest is a small eraser, and a #2. He steps back, staring at Buffy.  The expression on his horrible face seems to have changed to one almost of respect.  Her look is unfathomable. Lothos smiles, graciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He falls gently to the ground.  He's dust before he hits it. Silence.  One by one the vampires, stricken, slip out into the night.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't let her in!  Don't let her in!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) They'll kill us!  Get her out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get away from me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You bitch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) You would challenge me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing; to Buffy) I'll rip the flesh from your stinking bones!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) I am a God!  A God!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am so sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It doesn't... hurt... as much as I had imagined.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kneeling by Andy's body.  He gets up, and walks toward what's left of Lothos, warily keeping his eye on the spot.  In the background we see Gary Murray, running out after a vampire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pike kneels by the pile of dust with a pencil in it. Everybody is looking at Buffy.  She stares back at the students who cast her out.  Turns and walks out.  Pike follows her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Just a minute, you!  I'm not finished with you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We see the direct aftermath; the gym, police cars, people helping the wounded.  Over this is the voice of a reporter.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The death toll now reaches twelve and a half in the tragedy of Hemery High School.  It was at the Senior Prom five days ago that the school was beset by a roving gang of crack- crazed gunmen.  Survivors say some two hundred of the ruffians laid the school gym under a kind of siege, claiming several lives in the process.  Said one administrator, 'Things here will never be the same.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Students walk, holding their books talking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Students passing notes, yawning, falling asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Students window shopping, sucking on slurpies, laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the blue water FILLING THE SCREEN.  Kimberly dives gracefully into it, comes up on the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kim climbs out and joins Jeffrey, Jennifer and a boy and girl we don't know.  They are all in bathing gear, with fluorescent zinc on their noses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer nods.  Kimberly wrinkles her nose in distaste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jennifer glares at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She was even crazier after that.  I mean it, you wouldn't even have recognized her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Buffy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She didn't even hardly talk to anyone in school.  All year.  She didn't even go to the prom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I heard she got straight A's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (continuing) That's what I heard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The worst is, her parents -- this is true -- her parents were gonna send her to the Bahamas for graduation, and she refused.  True story.  She said she didn't want to go.  It is to vomit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, where is she now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Buffy and Pike are walking up the elaborate stone drive toward us.  We can't really tell where they are, but there are trees, hills in the background. Buffy leads the way.  She is confident, at ease.  She wears a large old sports jacket, a baseball cap pulled backward.  Skirt and sneakers.  Casual, cool, but disarming.  She carries a knapsack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buffy stops at a large, elaborately carved door.  She turns to Pike.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't say it was a bad idea, I just said the timing was off.  We could maybe wait till later.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be such a fraidy-cat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's afraid?  Besides me, I mean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We've come all this way.  We just have to check it out.  I got a hunch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're the boss, boss.  I just thought maybe we should wait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trust me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Buffy grabs the large metal knocker, ringed through a gargoyle's mouth. And on the boom of the knocker, we see:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE - THE CASTLE The castle.  Archetypal, turreted, terrifying.  Standing lonely on the craggy hill, drenched in the light of the rising moon.
direction.name: direction
